@apaszke I think SIMD vectorization in #2764 might come from https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/2764/files#diff-0898bb4475bffe9488f7e8dc5fd80ff4R375

But I'm still suspicious why my basic benchmarks with numpy were giving such great performances even though they were single threaded.

@MlWoo about your question on conv3d, I think this relates a bit with torch/nn#501. We would need to recompute the finput buffer for the gradient accumulation, and that might take some extra time. On the other hand, having a huge buffer for conv3d dependent on the batch size is not great because it is much more memory hungry than the one in conv2d.
